meanings.definition: To have drunk deeply or heartily.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids waughted glasses of cold lemonade.
meanings.sent2: She waughted the warm soup on a chilly evening.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty puppy waughted the water from its bowl noisily.
meanings.sent4: The travelers waughted in the beauty of the sunset over the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted hiker waughted the refreshing stream water eagerly.

meanings.definition: To have taken a deep breath or gulp of air.
meanings.sent1: The swimmer waughted a big breath before diving into the pool.
meanings.sent2: He waughted the fresh morning air as he stepped outside.
meanings.sent3: The child waughted the delicious smell of cookies baking in the oven.
meanings.sent4: She waughted the salty sea breeze as she walked along the shore.
meanings.sent5: The singer waughted a deep breath before hitting the high note in the song.
